article_node.title: West Africa’s Largest Mining Event Comes to Senegal, Focusing on Mineral Resources and Economic Sovereignty
article_node.summary: The 8th Senegal Mining Conference and Exhibition (SIM Senegal 2025) will take place in Dakar from 4‑6 Nov 2025, positioning Senegal as a West African mining hub. The event, hosted under the patronage of President Bassirou Diomaye Diakhar Faye and organized by the Ministry of Energy, Petroleum and Mines with AME Trade, will feature over 100 companies from 30+ countries and focus on the theme “Mineral resources, a lever of economic sovereignty.” Key participants include major mining firms such as Endeavour Mining, Eramet, and SOMISEN, as well as service providers like Total Energies and Carmeuse. The conference aims to showcase Senegal’s strategy to boost local processing, reduce foreign dependence, and integrate its mineral supply into global value chains.
